Unicron started to stir. He decided to go to Earth in person, Matrix 
or no Matrix. With the energon of that world, he would be able to 
empower his Minions and create a Gestalt-sized army to rule the 
universe.

His reactors began throbbing mutely, but soon, he advanced, his 
thousands of minions following around him.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Bloodblade, orbiting Earth disguised as a pod, got a confirmation 
> that Rockseeker and Lunekill were both terminated. Reluctantly, he 
> decided to warn his Master.
> 
> Bloodblade: Master Unicron, Rockseeeker and Lunekill have just been 
> terminated.
> 
> The response was immediate and terrible. He was attacked both in 
his 
> body and in his spark, even though his Lord was at the other end of 
> the system. Tendrils of electricity shook him, causing 
interferences 
> that could be picked up from Earth.
> 
> In the middle of his agony, he heard a thundrous voice inside his 
> head.
> 
> Unicron: Incompetent Minions! They have failed me. Now, Bloodblade, 
> it is your turn to go, but I have learned from this.
> 
> When the pain stopped, he had forgotten who he was or who he 
served. 
> He only remembered his name. He started spinning wildly as he 
entered 
> high orbit and was attracted to the ground.
> 
> A few minutes later, he crashed loudly into the ground, exactly at 
> the same distance from the three bases.
